title: Building and Sustaining Management Research Capacity: Developing Researchers Through the Life Course and Creating a Coordinating Infrastructure
abstractText: Building on previous RDI awards, this project extends the activities to build and sustain research capacity in UK Management and related social science disciplines.  These activities will provide support for researchers in four key areas of activity and, in parallel, establish an infrastructure of support to manage the various strands of existing and new funding in such a way that the sectorâ€™s approach to capacity building is both co-ordinated and coherent. The four sets of activities for which support is sought are targeted at different career points.  They are: (1) the establishment of a formal panel that comprises stakeholders within the management and business community to oversee the development of capacity building within the sector (2007/08); (2) the mainstreaming of a number of a number of methodological developments from the wider social sciences into management research (2007/08); (3) continuing support for an annual doctoral symposium (2008/09 and 2009/10); and (4) biennial workshops on writing qualitative and quantitative articles for top rated journals, targeted at mid-career and senior academics (2007/08 and 2009/10).
